alert.note: Alert for Western Franklin; Western Hampden; Western Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 11:35PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Hampshire, west central Franklin and northwestern Hampden Counties through 1230 AM EDT... At 1131 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near East Windsor to Housatonic. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Frequent lightning, gusty winds to 30 mph, and heavy rain SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause a few downed branches. Locations impacted include... Conway, Ashfield, Chester, Chesterfield, Worthington, Goshen, Cummington, Plainfield, Middlefield and Hawley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed.

area.areaDesc: Western Franklin; Western Hampden; Western Hampshire
